body: A PR sounds reasonable to me, would it work if you used the `gid` set in `SetupUserNamespace` https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/2bb4eb99fb012a9b628f2953ce149586456be18c/src/main/tools/linux-sandbox-pid1.cc#L231 and set `ping_group_range` to `0 <gid>`?

issue.title: makes ICMP works under fakeroot

labels.name: team-Local-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
network namespace reset /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ping_group_range to default value 1 0, which can't map to valid gid, prevent IPPPROTO_ICMP to work. fix this by written valid gid 0 0, only possible for fakeroot. podman has similar process https://github.com/containers/common/blob/ae4a61e1b2e0af84a668f87f7622d86ebc418cba/pkg/config/containers.conf#L80

detail information here https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/23275

body:
I've tried it and it won't work (https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/discussions/4366)

both value of ping_group_range, must be valid gid in the namespace, if any one of them is not, then kernel will reject changes and write fail (https://discuss.linuxcontainers.org/t/setting-net-ipv4-ping-group-range-inside-an-lxd-container/2162/4), 
  bazel use unpriviledged namespace, it can only have 1 gid mapped, thus both values must be inner_gid.  write to this file requires root permission, so it's impossible to write values other than 0 0 .  so in conclusion, this can only works under fakeroot  (seems a bug of kernel to me, too restrict on IPPROTO_ICMP, or default config inconsistent between sysctl and unpriviledged namespace), 

I've created PR here https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/23411
